title: NY Dems rally around Letitia James after bank fraud indictment
shortDescription: The defense of James by fellow New York Democrats marked a stark contrast from New York City Mayor Eric Adams' prosecution just over a year ago.

title: Israeli government approves hostage-release phase of Trump plan
shortDescription: The approval of the framework by the Israeli government paves the way for Hamas-held hostages to be released.

title: Trump says he's in 'great shape'
shortDescription: President Donald Trump is set to undergo a medical checkup at Walter Reed Medical Center, in what will be the president's second exam there this year.

title: See Trump's Nobel Peace mentions in 1 minute
shortDescription: Over the years, President Donald Trump has noted some of his accomplishments, including claims that he’s "stopped seven wars."

title: Longtime Trump foe Letitia James indicted for bank fraud
shortDescription: New York AG Letitia James was indicted Oct. 9, less than three weeks after President Donald Trump publicly called for her to face charges.

title: 'I'll let you know': Trump says he feels great before latest physical
shortDescription: President Trump, 79, described his Friday visit to Walter Reed as a "semi-annual physical" after undergoing an earlier physical in April.

title: 'They'll find a reason not to give it to me.' Trump on Peace Prize
shortDescription: President Donald Trump answered a question by USA TODAY's White House correspondent on whether he thinks he will win the Nobel Peace Prize.

title: Trump celebra a Colón como héroe y reabre el debate sobre su legado
shortDescription: Trump llama “héroe” a Colón y reaviva el debate sobre el Día de la Raza en EE. UU. entre memoria histórica, identidad y justicia social.

title: Trump honors Christopher Columbus amid controversy
shortDescription: President Donald Trump signed a proclamation celebrating Christopher Columbus as “the original American hero” and accusing his critics of slander.

title: RFK Jr. and Trump link circumcision to autism through Tylenol
shortDescription: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. noted boys who are circumcised have higher rates of autism, which he said could be a result of Tylenol.

title: Trump's strikes on boats killed 21. A Senate push to stop them failed.
shortDescription: A Senate measure to stop President Donald Trump's strikes on boats he has claimed, without evidence, are carrying drugs failed to pass its first vote.

title: She was elected to Congress Sept. 23. She still can't take her seat.
shortDescription: Adelita Grijalva won an Arizona special election. She'd be the key to forcing a vote on releasing the Epstein files. But she can't get sworn in.

title: Trump jabs Schumer, predicts he'll retire
shortDescription: President Donald Trump took swipes at top Democrats during a Cabinet meeting, saying "we really don't know who the hell is leading" them.

title: 'We're calling it Columbus Day.' Trump ditches Indigenous Peoples Day
shortDescription: The Trump administration has taken a keen interest in how U.S. history is presented, targeting alleged "woke" policies and institutions.

title: 'My kids could die': Military wife confronts Mike Johnson over shutdown
shortDescription: "My kids could die," a military wife from Virginia frustratedly told the speaker of the House.

title: President Trump eyes Nobel Peace Prize
shortDescription: Trump repeated the claim he stopped seven wars when asked by USA TODAY White House correspondent Swapna Venugopal Ramaswamy about Nobel Peace Prize.

title: With a Mideast accord, Trump has legacy on his mind - Nobel or not
shortDescription: The president touts 'a deal for 3,000 years' between Israel and Hamas. The focus on history's judgment? Call it Second-Term Syndrome.

title: Trump's troop deployments in Chicago, Portland argued in court
shortDescription: Judges on Thursday, Oct. 9, heard arguments over the legality of President Trump's deployment of National Guard troops to Portland and Chicago.

title: Trump speaks to hostage families on phone
shortDescription: President Donald Trump spoke with families of Israeli hostages, telling them their loved ones will return in a few days.
